meanings.definition: To remove or unload from a ship.
meanings.sent1: The workers will unship the cargo from the large vessel.
meanings.sent2: It is important to unship the goods carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent3: After a long voyage, the crew was eager to unship the heavy crates.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a captain unshipping the burden of responsibility from her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The process to unship the equipment was slow but necessary for safety reasons.

meanings.definition: To take out of a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: Please unship the supplies before we set sail.
meanings.sent2: The sailors had to unship the damaged parts for repairs.
meanings.sent3: The pirates tried to unship the treasure without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: He had to unship the water that had leaked into the boat.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to unship the passengers from the sinking ship.

meanings.definition: To remove from a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: They will unship the equipment once we reach the port.
meanings.sent2: It's necessary to unship the crew during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The captain decided to unship the extra weight to increase speed.
meanings.sent4: She had to unship the anchor quickly to avoid drifting away.
meanings.sent5: The team had to unship the damaged boat from the rocks before it sank.
